procedures.title: Initial Grill Setup
steps: Remove protective plastic film from all surfaces
Wipe clean with soft cloth
Install grill in countertop cutout
Connect 48VDC power supply
Verify control panel illuminates
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill properly installed and powered on

procedures.title: Basic Grill Operation
steps: Press power button to turn on
Select desired temperature using IntelliKEN Touch controls
Allow grill to preheat
Place food on cooking surface when temperature reached
Monitor cooking progress
Turn off grill when finished
procedures.expected_outcome: Food cooked to desired temperature

procedures.title: Cleaning Procedure
steps: Remove grates if applicable
Wipe surface with damp cloth
Use mild soap if needed
Dry thoroughly
Apply food-grade protectant if desired
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean cooking surface ready for next use

procedures.title: Pre-Operation Safety Check
steps: Read all instructions before using the grill
Verify power cord and wires are not damaged
Ensure grill surface is not cracked
Check that handles and knobs are secure
Verify drip tray is present
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is safe to operate

procedures.title: Drip Tray Setup
steps: Place minimum of two cups of water in disposable drip tray
Insert drip tray into designated location
Clean drip tray after each use
procedures.expected_outcome: Drip tray properly prepared for grilling

procedures.title: Portable Grill Storage
steps: Disconnect from power source
Allow grill to cool completely
Clean all surfaces
Store indoors
Keep out of reach of children
Use protective cover if exposed to weather
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill properly stored for safety

procedures.title: Post-Use Shutdown
steps: Disconnect from power source
Allow grill to cool completely
Remove cooking grates
Remove disposable drip tray
Clean all components
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill properly shut down and cleaned

procedures.title: Malfunction Response
steps: Switch off the appliance immediately
Disconnect from power source
Contact KENYON Customer Care at (860) 664-4906
Discontinue use until repaired
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe shutdown of malfunctioning unit

procedures.title: Safety Lock Feature
steps: Activate safety lock feature
Press and hold both UP and DOWN arrows simultaneously for 3 seconds
Control panel will lock to prevent accidental operation
procedures.expected_outcome: Control panel locked and secured

procedures.title: Heat Level Cooking Mode Operation
steps: Turn on grill
Select Heat Level cooking mode
Adjust heat level using UP/DOWN arrows
Monitor indicator lights
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill operating in Heat Level mode

procedures.title: Temperature Cooking Mode Operation
steps: Turn on grill
Select Temperature cooking mode
Set desired temperature using UP/DOWN arrows
Monitor indicator lights
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill operating in Temperature mode

procedures.title: Change Temperature Units
steps: Access temperature unit settings
Toggle between Fahrenheit and Celsius
procedures.expected_outcome: Temperature units changed to desired scale

procedures.title: Lid Removal Procedure
preconditions: Grill is cool and safe to handle
steps: Locate lid removal mechanism
Follow lid removal instructions
Store lid safely
procedures.expected_outcome: Lid successfully removed from grill

procedures.title: Timer Operation
steps: Access timer options
Set desired cooking time
Monitor automatic shut-off time
procedures.expected_outcome: Timer set and operating correctly

procedures.title: Frontier Built-in Grill B70750 Installation
preconditions: Ensure power supply meets voltage requirements: 48V DC (35V DC min - 55V DC max)
Verify available space meets cutout dimensions
steps: Prepare cutout space according to dimensions: 19 3/4" width x 11 5/8" depth
Ensure 1/4" (6mm) radius on corners of cutout
Allow for 1" clearance below unit for drain fitting
Install unit into cutout space
Connect 48V DC power supply
Verify amp draw does not exceed 27 amps
Test for proper 1300W output
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill properly installed and functioning within specified power parameters

procedures.title: Frontier Portable Grill B70790 Setup
preconditions: Ensure power supply meets voltage requirements: 48V DC (35V DC min - 55V DC max)
Verify adequate space for unit dimensions
steps: Place unit on level surface
Ensure minimum clearance around unit based on dimensions: 21" width x 12" depth x 8 9/16" height
Connect 48V DC power supply
Verify amp draw does not exceed 27 amps
Test for proper 1300W output
procedures.expected_outcome: Portable grill properly positioned and functioning within specified power parameters

procedures.title: Initial Safety Setup
steps: Ensure grill is installed per instructions
Have qualified electrician verify proper grounding
Connect to DC power supply protected by 30-amp circuit breaker
Verify residual current device (RCD) rated not exceeding 30A is installed
Examine power wires for signs of damage
procedures.expected_outcome: Safely installed and properly powered grill

procedures.title: Quick Start Operation
steps: Remove grates and drip trays
Clean grates and drip trays
Insert drip tray into bottom of grill
Fill drip tray with 2 cups of liquid (water, beer, or wine)
Re-install cooking grate
Close lid and preheat for 5-7 minutes
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill ready for cooking

procedures.title: Temperature Settings Guide
steps: For vegetables: Set temperature to 350°F or power setting 4
For chicken, pork and fish: Set temperature to 400°F or power setting 5
For hamburgers: Set temperature to 500°F or power setting 9
For steak: Set temperature to 550°F or power setting 16
procedures.expected_outcome: Proper temperature for specific food type

procedures.title: Post-Cooking Maintenance
steps: Remove grate/griddle
Place grate/griddle in dishwasher
Remove and empty drip tray contents
Clean drip tray
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean grill ready for next use

procedures.title: Fire Emergency Procedure
steps: Do not use water to extinguish fire
Use dry chemical fire extinguisher
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe fire extinguishment

procedures.title: SilKEN Built-in Grill Installation Specifications
preconditions: Verify installation space meets minimum cutout dimensions
Ensure power supply meets voltage requirements (35V DC - 55V DC)
steps: Confirm cutout width of 19 3/4" (502mm)
Confirm cutout depth of 11 5/8" (295mm)
Verify corner radius of 1/4" (6mm)
Allow for 1" drain fitting clearance in height
Ensure power supply can provide 27 amps at 48V DC
Verify maximum power output requirement of 1300 watts
procedures.expected_outcome: Proper installation space prepared for Model B70770

procedures.title: SilKEN Portable Grill Installation Requirements
preconditions: Ensure power supply meets voltage requirements (35V DC - 55V DC)
Verify adequate space for unit dimensions
steps: Confirm space for width of 21" (533mm)
Confirm space for depth of 12 1/16" (306mm)
Allow for height of 9 5/8" (244mm)
Ensure power supply can provide 27 amps at 48V DC
Verify maximum power output requirement of 1300 watts
procedures.expected_outcome: Proper installation space prepared for Model B70772

procedures.title: Verify Installation Dimensions
steps: Confirm width clearance of 19 3/4" (502mm)
Confirm depth clearance of 11 5/8" (295mm)
Verify corner radius requirement of 1/4" (6mm)
Account for 1" drain fitting in height calculation
Ensure total height clearance of 4 15/16" (125mm)
procedures.expected_outcome: Installation space meets required dimensions for Model B70760

procedures.title: Verify Power Requirements
steps: Confirm power source provides 48V DC nominal voltage
Verify voltage range falls between 35V DC minimum and 55V DC maximum
Ensure power source can supply 27 amps
Confirm circuit can handle 1300 watts output
procedures.expected_outcome: Power source meets electrical requirements for safe operation

Disconnect from power source
Contact KENYON Customer Care at (860) 664-4906
Discontinue use until repaired
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe shutdown of malfunctioning unit

procedures.title: Safety Lock Feature
steps: Activate safety lock feature
Press and hold both UP and DOWN arrows simultaneously for 3 seconds
Control panel will lock to prevent accidental operation
procedures.expected_outcome: Control panel locked and secured

procedures.title: Initial Grill Setup
steps: Unpack the grill carefully
Check electrical supply requirements
Prepare countertop according to specifications
Connect drain
Position outlet in correct location
Complete final preparations before first use
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill properly installed and ready for use

procedures.title: Heat Level Cooking Mode Operation

Select Heat Level cooking mode
Adjust heat level using UP/DOWN arrows
Monitor indicator lights
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill operating in Heat Level mode

Select Temperature cooking mode
Set desired temperature using UP/DOWN arrows
Monitor indicator lights

procedures.title: Change Temperature Units

Toggle between Fahrenheit and Celsius

procedures.title: Lid Removal Procedure
preconditions: Grill is cool and safe to handle
steps: Locate lid removal mechanism
Follow lid removal instructions
Store lid safely
procedures.expected_outcome: Lid successfully removed from grill

procedures.title: Timer Operation
steps: Access timer options
Set desired cooking time
Monitor automatic shut-off time
procedures.expected_outcome: Timer set and operating correctly

Test for proper 1300W output

Remove and empty drip tray contents
Clean drip tray
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean grill ready for next use

procedures.title: Fire Emergency Procedure

Use dry chemical fire extinguisher
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe fire extinguishment

procedures.title: SilKEN Built-in Grill Installation Specifications
preconditions: Verify installation space meets minimum cutout dimensions
Ensure power supply meets voltage requirements (35V DC - 55V DC)
steps: Confirm cutout width of 19 3/4" (502mm)
Confirm cutout depth of 11 5/8" (295mm)
Verify corner radius of 1/4" (6mm)
Allow for 1" drain fitting clearance in height
Ensure power supply can provide 27 amps at 48V DC
Verify maximum power output requirement of 1300 watts

steps: Confirm space for width of 21" (533mm)
Confirm space for depth of 12 1/16" (306mm)
Allow for height of 9 5/8" (244mm)
Ensure power supply can provide 27 amps at 48V DC
Verify maximum power output requirement of 1300 watts

procedures.title: Verify Installation Dimensions

Verify corner radius requirement of 1/4" (6mm)
Account for 1" drain fitting in height calculation
Ensure total height clearance of 4 15/16" (125mm)

procedures.title: Verify Power Requirements
steps: Confirm power source provides 48V DC nominal voltage
Verify voltage range falls between 35V DC minimum and 55V DC maximum
Ensure power source can supply 27 amps
Confirm circuit can handle 1300 watts output
procedures.expected_outcome: Power source meets electrical requirements for safe operation

procedures.title: Pre-Use Stainless Steel Surface Cleaning
steps: Obtain a damp cloth
Wipe down all stainless steel surfaces
Remove any residue from previous grilling sessions
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean stainless steel surfaces free of residue

procedures.title: Monthly Stainless Steel Maintenance
steps: Obtain provided stainless steel cleaner
Apply cleaner to stainless steel surfaces
Clean monthly
procedures.expected_outcome: Maintained and protected stainless steel surfaces

procedures.title: Touch Control Area Cleaning
steps: Obtain glass cleaner and soft towel
Apply glass cleaner to towel
Clean ceramic glass touch control area
For stubborn stains, use ceramic glass cleaner
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean touch control area free of dirt and stains

procedures.title: Initial Grill Setup and Cleaning
steps: Remove cooking grate and drip tray from grill
Wash grill with warm soapy water using non-abrasive cloth
Ensure drip tray is fully inserted into bottom of grill
Verify electric element bracket rests on element support bracket
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean, properly assembled grill ready for use

procedures.title: Drip Tray Preparation
steps: Cover bottom of drip tray with liquid (water, apple juice for pork, lime soda for fish)
DO NOT USE FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly prepared drip tray for grilling

procedures.title: Grill Preheating Procedure
steps: Close lid
Preheat for 5-7 minutes on desired setting:
For steak - Set to 550°F/Power setting 16
For burgers - Set to 500°F/Power setting 9
For pork and fish - Set to 400°F/Power setting 5
For vegetables - Set to 350°F/Power setting 4
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly preheated grill at correct temperature

procedures.title: Post-Cooking Cleaning Procedure
steps: Place paper towels on grilling surface
Pour one ounce water on towel
Use high temperature nylon tongs to swab surface
Dispose of paper towel
Wipe grates with dry paper towel
Remove grate when cool and place in dishwasher
Lift electric elements
Remove and empty drip tray
Wipe drip tray with dry paper towel
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean grill ready for next use

procedures.title: Lid Cleaning Procedure
steps: Remove lid from grill
Place lid in dishwasher
Run on pots & pans cycle
procedures.expected_outcome: Restored pristine appearance of grill lid

procedures.title: Understanding Indicator Lights
steps: Observe LED light array adjacent to control panels
When control is ON, LED light array will illuminate
HOT indicator light shows when cooking grate is too warm to touch
Wait for HOT indicator light to turn off before touching cooking surface
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe operation through visual indicators

procedures.title: Safety Lock Operation - When Grill is ON
steps: Activate lock feature
Power settings will be locked from adjustment
Press zone power or master power button to turn off grill if needed
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill settings locked for safety

procedures.title: Safety Lock Operation - When Grill is OFF
steps: Activate lock feature
All control panel functions will be deactivated
Master power button will not function while locked
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill completely locked from operation

procedures.title: Turning On the Grill
steps: Touch POWER button in main control frame with flat part of fingertips
Hold element power button for 2 seconds
Choose cooking option within 15 seconds
If no selection made within 15 seconds, grill will automatically power off
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill powered on and ready for cooking

procedures.title: Setting Cooking Mode
steps: Choose between heating level mode (low to high)
OR select specific cooking temperature mode
procedures.expected_outcome: Desired cooking mode selected

procedures.title: Fire Emergency Response
steps: Do NOT use water on grease fires
Smother fire/flame
OR use dry chemical extinguisher
OR use foam-type extinguisher
procedures.expected_outcome: Fire safely extinguished

procedures.title: Safe Pot Holder Usage
steps: Use only DRY pot holders
Avoid moist/damp pot holders
Keep pot holders away from grate/element
Do not substitute towels or bulky cloth for pot holders
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe handling of hot surfaces without burns

procedures.title: Regular Cleaning Procedure
steps: Remove drip tray
Clean drip tray thoroughly
Clean baffle tray
Use cloth for cleaning
Use stainless steel or glass surface cleaner only
Never use pressurized water
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean grill with properly maintained drip system

procedures.title: Smoke Prevention
steps: Place 2 cups of water in drip tray
Or add enough water to cover bottom of pan
procedures.expected_outcome: Reduced smoke during cooking

procedures.title: Storage Procedure
steps: For portable grills: Store indoors
For built-in grills: Provide suitable shelter from rain
Optional: Use covers available at cookwithkenyon.com
procedures.expected_outcome: Protected grill during storage

procedures.title: Broken Grate Emergency Procedure
steps: Stop using grill immediately
Contact authorized service center
OR contact Kenyon Customer Care at (860) 664-4906
procedures.expected_outcome: Prevention of electric shock or fire hazard

procedures.title: Temperature Cooking Mode Operation
steps: Touch the thermometer/gradient graphic to select temperature cooking mode
Select desired cooking temperature using one of two methods:
Method 1: Press + or - buttons for each 10°F/12°C increment
Method 2: Swipe along the temperature control arc
Wait for selected temperature value to stop flashing (indicates temperature reached)
procedures.expected_outcome: Element maintains selected cooking temperature

procedures.title: Heat Level Cooking Mode Operation
steps: Swipe finger along temperature control arc to desired setting
Alternatively, use + and - signs to toggle heat level
Observe LED light array for selected setting confirmation
procedures.expected_outcome: Element maintains selected heat level

procedures.title: Changing Temperature Units
steps: Locate °F/°C button in main power control frame
Touch °F/°C button to toggle between Fahrenheit and Celsius
procedures.expected_outcome: Temperature units change and remain as default for future use

procedures.title: Auto Power-Off Safety Feature
steps: Element will automatically de-power after 15 seconds of inactivity at 0 heat level
procedures.expected_outcome: Element powers off automatically for safety

procedures.title: Automatic Shut-Off Time Settings
steps: Select heat setting between 1-16
Note corresponding automatic shut-off time:
Settings 1-4: 90 minutes
Settings 5-10: 70 minutes
Settings 11-16: 60 minutes
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill will automatically shut off after specified time period

procedures.title: Temperature Guide for Food Types
preconditions: Lid should be closed for optimal performance
steps: For eggs and griddle cooking: Use settings 1-2
For pancakes and French toast: Use settings 3-4
For vegetables: Use settings 5-6
For vegetables and fish: Use settings 7-8
For fish and chicken: Use settings 9-10
For chicken and hamburgers: Use settings 11-12
For hamburgers and steaks: Use settings 13-14
For steaks: Use settings 15-16
procedures.expected_outcome: Food cooked at appropriate temperature for optimal results

procedures.title: Setting Cooking Timer
steps: Touch the clock graphic within element control frame
Touch + or - buttons to set desired time duration
Hold button to increase/decrease setting faster
Touch timer button to start countdown
Monitor remaining time on display
Wait for automatic shutoff at end of set time
procedures.expected_outcome: Heating element automatically shuts off when timer reaches zero

procedures.title: Setting Kitchen Timer
steps: Touch timer clock graphic within element control frame
Touch + or - buttons to set desired time duration
Hold button to increase/decrease setting faster
Touch timer button again to start countdown
Monitor remaining time on display
Touch power button to silence alarm when timer completes
procedures.expected_outcome: Timer counts down and alerts user when time is complete

procedures.title: Timer Operation Details
steps: For 1-10 minutes: Set in 1 minute increments
Above 10 minutes: Set in 5 minute increments
Timer will deactivate after 20 seconds if no time is set
Display shows minutes until last minute
Display switches to seconds for final minute
Respond to completion alarm
procedures.expected_outcome: Timer operates with correct increment steps and display format

procedures.title: Error Code Resolution E04
steps: Allow unit to cool down
Verify correct cooking utensil type is being used
Lower the cooking level or temperature setting
procedures.expected_outcome: Normal operation temperature restored
models: Kenyon Single Zone Grill with IntelliKEN Touch™

procedures.title: Error Code Resolution E06-E09
preconditions: Unit displaying error code E06, E07, E08, or E09
steps: Contact Kenyon Customer Care at 860-664-4906
Available Monday-Friday, 8AM – 5PM EST
Alternative: email customercare@cookwithkenyon.com
procedures.expected_outcome: Internal electronic control issue resolved
models: Kenyon Single Zone Grill with IntelliKEN Touch™

procedures.title: Error Code Resolution E10
steps: De-power the unit
Restart the unit
Use only one control input at a time
procedures.expected_outcome: Normal control function restored
models: Kenyon Single Zone Grill with IntelliKEN Touch™

procedures.title: General Error Resolution Procedure
steps: De-power the unit
Restart the unit to clear the display
Allow unit to cool if necessary
Lock out main power supply by closing breaker before any wiring operations
If problem persists, contact Kenyon Customer Care
procedures.expected_outcome: Error cleared and normal operation restored
models: Kenyon Single Zone Grill with IntelliKEN Touch™

procedures.title: Heating Element Operation
steps: To raise element: Lift until it stays in up position
To lower element: Apply slight downward pressure
procedures.expected_outcome: Heating element moves to desired position for access to baffle/drip tray

procedures.title: Drip Tray Installation
preconditions: Baffle tray must be in place
steps: Position drip tray inside baffle tray
Ensure rim of drip tray does not protrude outside baffle tray
Add 2 cups of water (or enough to cover bottom) to prevent smoking
procedures.expected_outcome: Drip tray properly seated and ready for use

procedures.title: Grate Cleaning Procedure
steps: Remove grate after use
Prepare warm soapy water
Wash grate thoroughly
Dry completely before replacing
procedures.expected_outcome: Clean, non-stick grate surface ready for next use

procedures.title: Drip Tray Maintenance
steps: Wait for grill to cool completely
Remove drip tray carefully
Empty contents after each use
Clean tray if needed
Replace tray properly within baffle tray
procedures.expected_outcome: Empty, clean drip tray ready for next use

procedures.title: Lid Height Adjustment
preconditions: SilKEN® Portable or Built-in Grill model
steps: Locate the top handle on the silicone lid
Use top handle to adjust lid height
Expand or collapse lid accordion-style to desired height
procedures.expected_outcome: Lid height adjusted between 2 inches (collapsed) and full height

procedures.title: Lid Removal for Cleaning
preconditions: SilKEN® Portable or Built-in Grill model
steps: Locate the quick release pin in the hinge
Remove the quick release pin
Grasp the lid
Lift left side to clear the hinge
Slide lid to the left until clear of right hinge pin
Wash removed lid in warm, soapy water
procedures.expected_outcome: Lid successfully removed and cleaned

procedures.title: Lid Operation Safety
preconditions: SilKEN® Portable or Built-in Grill model
steps: Use front handle when lid is hinged
Use top handle only for height adjustment
Allow grill to cool completely before collapsing lid
Ensure vents on three sides remain unobstructed
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe operation of grill lid

procedures.title: Unpacking and Verifying Grill Components
steps: Carefully unpack the grill from shipping container
Verify package contents includes: VDC IntelliKEN Touch™, Stainless steel cleaner, 3 feet of drain hose, 4 mounting brass fitting screws
Inspect all components for damage
Contact KENYON immediately if components are missing or damaged
procedures.expected_outcome: All grill components verified and ready for installation

procedures.title: Electrical Supply Verification
steps: Verify electrical supply meets product specifications: 1300 Watts, 48V DC 27A
Confirm voltage range is between MIN 35V DC and MAX 55V DC
Ensure power supply runs up to 40' use 8AWG wiring
Verify disconnection means is incorporated in fixed wiring per wiring rules
Consult licensed electrician if specifications don't match
procedures.expected_outcome: Electrical supply confirmed suitable for grill installation

procedures.title: Initial Grill Preparation Before First Use
preconditions: Grill has not been used yet
steps: Remove protective plastic film from the lid
Remove protective film from trim flange
Remove protective film from glass panel
Clean entire grill with stainless steel or glass cleaner to remove adhesives and manufacturing oils
Wash nonstick coated grates in warm soapy water
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is clean and ready for first use

procedures.title: Grill Installation Clearance Requirements
preconditions: Countertop must be prepared for grill installation
Measurements must be verified before cutting
steps: Ensure 13 inches maximum depth of overhead cabinets
Verify 36 inches minimum height of countertop above floor
Confirm flat countertop surface matches or exceeds overall grill dimensions
Maintain 30 inches minimum clearance between cooking surface and unprotected cabinets
Maintain 24 inches minimum clearance if cabinet is protected with flame retardant materials
Keep 6-inch minimum from backsplash to edge of grill
Maintain 1-1/2 inches minimum from front of counter to grill
Allow 2 inch minimum clearance between grill bottom and combustible surfaces below
For Canadian installations: maintain 1/2 inch minimum from any adjacent surface
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill properly positioned with safe clearances on all sides

procedures.title: Grill Flange Installation
preconditions: Grill with factory-installed stainless steel flange ready
steps: Apply non-adhesive sealant (recommended: Plumber's Putty) to countertop edge beneath trim flange
Position grill in countertop opening
Secure flange using four oval head wood screws
Clean excess sealant if necessary
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill securely mounted with sealed flange

procedures.title: Grill Removal Procedure
steps: Obtain fishing line
Run fishing line back and forth under the trim flange
Continue until caulk bond breaks
Lift grill from countertop
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill safely removed from countertop

procedures.title: Grill Installation with Plumber's Putty
preconditions: For granite/marble/quartz/sandstone/Corian countertops, stain-free plumber's putty required
steps: Shape plumber's putty by hand
Apply putty around the edge/flange of grill
Install grill into countertop
Seal grill to countertop using the putty
procedures.expected_outcome: Watertight seal between grill and countertop

procedures.title: Countertop Cutout Preparation
steps: Check clearance for grill against front and side walls of base cabinet
Verify ventilation space below countertop
Make cutout with 1/4 inch radius corners
Follow countertop manufacturer's instructions for reinforcement
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly sized and prepared countertop opening

procedures.title: Cabinet Ventilation Setup
preconditions: Tools for creating ventilation openings available
steps: Create minimum two openings in cabinet
Position one opening for fresh air intake
Position second opening for hot air escape
Ensure each opening equals 8 square inches minimum
For ambient temperatures above 85°F/30°C, increase opening sizes accordingly
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly ventilated cabinet space for grill operation

procedures.title: Drain Connection Installation
steps: Locate drain fitting on grill
Attach 90° brass elbow to drain fitting
Connect 5/8" ID flexible hose to brass elbow
procedures.expected_outcome: Properly connected drain system

procedures.title: Warranty Claim Process
preconditions: Product must be within warranty period
Defect must be from normal usage
steps: Contact kenyonservice@cookwithkenyon.com for return instructions
Return product to company for evaluation
Company will evaluate defect
If approved, company will repair or replace defective components
procedures.expected_outcome: Repaired or replaced product

procedures.title: Stainless Steel Maintenance for Lifetime Warranty
preconditions: Must be Kenyon stainless steel product
steps: Perform monthly care as outlined in owner's manual
If corrosion appears, document with photos
Contact company with photo evidence of corrosion
Submit for replacement components
procedures.expected_outcome: Rust-free stainless steel components

procedures.title: Warranty Service Authorization
preconditions: Service must be needed within warranty period
Product must be covered under warranty
steps: Contact Kenyon International for service authorization
Obtain pre-authorization for labor service
Use only Authorized Kenyon International Service Center
Complete service as specified in writing by company
procedures.expected_outcome: Authorized warranty service completed
